content: are for the full chart and should not be used when working the increases within the cable pattern 6 when adding the stitch at the end of the rs row over the cable pattern if the additional st occurs in the same place as a cable occurs ignore the cable and just work the stitches plain and incorporate the cable pattern as you work additional row 7 also note that the chart is given in both a landscape form suitable for printing and in portrait form if you are viewing it on a computer or a tablet directions set up row co 2 sts row1 rs kfb x2 4 sts row 2 ws knit row3 k2 kfb k1 5 sts row 4 knit row 5 k2 m1 k3 6 sts row 6 knit begin charted row the 48 row of the chart are worked twice and then row 1-16 are worked once again first repeat work each rs row to the first red line on the right hand side then work the remaining sts from the furthest red line on the left hand side work each ws row to the first red line on the left hand side then from the furthest red line on the right hand side to the end second repreat continue as established but work each rs row to the second red line from the right hand side of the chart and then from the furthest red line to the end work each ws to the first red line on the left hand side and them from the same red line for the rs row to the end third repeat of row 1-16 work the rs row to the 3rd red line from the right hand side of the chart then from furthest red line to the end each ws row is worked to the first red line on the left hand side then from the next red line to the end continue as established after row 16 continue with row 17 work the 58 sts of the cable pattern pm work in garter st to the last 3 sts then m1 k3 work all even row k to marker work the 58 sts of ws of cable pattern continue working the cable chart as established increasing 1 st at the end of each rs row until there are 160 sts on the needle ending with a ws row then begin the top garter stitch border work the top garter st border row 1 rs k3 p1 w & t row 2 ws k to end row 3 k3 w & t row 4 k to end row 5 k2 w & t row 6 k to end row 7 k4 picking up & knitting each wrap together with its corresponding stitch row 8 k to end row 9 k3 p1 ssk turn when working the ssk you will be slipping the last st of the border with the next st from the body of the
